message: I just started using emacs --daemon and emacsclient. It's pretty cool, but is there anything that I should add to my .emacs to make it completely awesome?
You can just add (server-start) and then just run emacs instead of emacs --daemon
I thought about doing that, but wouldn't that mean starting a bunch of different servers if I run more than one? I like the continuity and the fast start time of starting one server when I log in.
it errors if you try to run the server twice. at least with the default settings.
oh, you can also run emacsclient and specify a flag to start the server if it isn't running.
